column4: im good with gdb, but your python part is throwing me off. If i understand this your trying to install a python module via an approved ubuntu method... why not just install it manually?
I'm trying to use gdb's pretty printer.
well as for another channel, you can try #python or #gdb
What I understand so far is that I'm missing /usr/share/gdb/python/libstdcxx/v6/printers.py
do you happen to have this file?
google should have it, ive had alot of luck finding missing py files for blender
I've been googling for a while now. I guess I'll keep looking.
could you try something real quick for me?
ok
execute this on gdb: python import gdb.libstdcxx
and see if whether you get an ImportError
ImportError: No module named libstdcxx
are you running Ubuntu 10.10?
yeah 10.10 and I have tons of developer stuff setup
for whatever reason this module is not installed. I just cloned gdb's repo with the hopes I'll find something in there that will help me figure this out
and you also have libstdc++ 6 installed, correct?
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 19 2010-11-13 11:58 /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6 -> libstdc++.so.6.0.14
what about /usr/share/gdb/python/libstdcxx/v6/printers.py?
no, i dont like python so i only have minimal python related stuff
k
histo: I figured it out. Thanks for your help!
